Web search results for query: "Go 1.22 release notes"

Links: [{"title":"Release History - The Go Programming Language","url":"https://go.dev/doc/devel/release"},{"title":"Go 1.22 Release Notes - The Go Programming Language","url":"https://tip.golang.org/doc/go1.22"},{"title":"Go 1.22 is released! - The Go Programming Language","url":"https://go.dev/blog/go1.22"},{"title":"Go 1.22 interactive tour","url":"https://antonz.org/go-1-22/"},{"title":"The last article about Go 1.22 you need to read","url":"https://appliedgo.com/blog/the-last-article-about-go-1-22-you-need-to-read"},{"title":"[go] doc: start draft Go 1.22 release notes","url":"https://groups.google.com/g/golang-codereviews/c/ch8hQDtqOPo"},{"title":"doc: write release notes for Go 1.22 · Issue #61422 · golang/go","url":"https://github.com/golang/go/issues/61422"},{"title":"Go 1.22 Personal Top Features. Exploring Go 1.22’s Best Upgrades | by Dmytro Misik | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@dmytro.misik/go-1-22-personal-top-features-57a4c95a2f56"},{"title":"Go 1.23.4 and Go 1.22.10 are released","url":"https://groups.google.com/g/golang-announce/c/3DyiMkYx4Fo"},{"title":"Go 1.24 Release Notes - The Go Programming Language","url":"https://go.dev/doc/go1.24"}]

Here's a summary of the Go 1.22 release notes:

## Go 1.22 Release Overview

Go 1.22 was released on February 6, 2024.(no content)Go 1.22 enhances for loops, brings new standard library functionality and improves performance.

### Key Language Changes

**For Loop Improvements:**
Go 1.22 finally fixes an unfortunate design decision about loop variables that bit thousands of developers while they were learning the language.(no content)The variable declared in the "for" loop is now created each new iteration. It avoids a lot of bugs related to sharing variables.(no content)Another new feature is the range over integers. The previous example can be simplified with Go 1.22 - you can now write `for i := range 10` instead of `for i := 0; i < 10; i++`.

### Standard Library Additions

**New math/rand/v2 Package:**
Go 1.22 includes the first "v2" package in the standard library, math/rand/v2.(no content)A new math/rand/v2 package provides a cleaner, more consistent API and uses higher-quality, faster pseudo-random generation algorithms.(no content)ChaCha8 is the algorithm used for the top-level functions in math/rand/v2. As of Go 1.22, math/rand's top-level functions (when not explicitly seeded) and the Go runtime also use ChaCha8 for randomness.

**Enhanced HTTP Routing:**
The patterns used by net/http.ServeMux now accept methods and wildcards. For example, the router accepts a pattern like GET /task/{id}/, which matches only GET requests and captures the value of the {id} segment in a map that can be accessed through Request values.

**Other Library Additions:**
- A new Null[T] type in database/sql provides a way to scan nullable columns.
- The new function Concat concatenates multiple slices.
- Functions that shrink the size of a slice (Delete, DeleteFunc, Compact, CompactFunc, and Replace) now zero the elements between the new length and the old length.

### Performance Improvements

Profile-guided Optimization (PGO) builds can now devirtualize a higher proportion of calls than previously possible. Most programs from a representative set of Go programs now see between 2 and 14% improvement at runtime from enabling PGO.(no content)The compiler now interleaves devirtualization and inlining, so interface method calls are better optimized.

### Tooling Changes

The trace tool's web UI has been gently refreshed as part of the work to support the new tracer, resolving several issues and improving the readability of various sub-pages. The web UI now supports exploring traces in a thread-oriented view.(no content)go get no longer works outside a module in legacy GOPATH mode. So in case you still have a legacy project that needs GO111MODULE=off, keep this in mind.

### Bootstrap Requirements

As mentioned in the Go 1.20 release notes, Go 1.22 now requires the final point release of Go 1.20 or later for bootstrap. We expect that Go 1.24 will require the final point release of Go 1.22 or later for bootstrap.

For the complete official release notes, you can visit the [Go 1.22 Release Notes](https://tip.golang.org/doc/go1.22) page.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.text:
## Go 1.22 Release Summary

Go 1.22 was released on February 6, 2024. Here are the key highlights:

### Language Changes

**For Loop Fix:**
- Loop variables are now created fresh for each iteration, fixing a long-standing source of bugs where closures would capture the same variable
- New range-over-integers syntax: `for i := range 10` instead of `for i := 0; i < 10; i++`

### Standard Library

**math/rand/v2** - First "v2" package in the standard library:
- Cleaner, more consistent API
- Uses ChaCha8 algorithm for higher-quality, faster pseudo-random generation

**Enhanced HTTP Routing (net/http.ServeMux):**
- Patterns now accept HTTP methods and wildcards
- Example: `GET /task/{id}/` matches only GET requests and captures `{id}`

**Other additions:**
- `database/sql.Null[T]` - generic type for nullable columns
- `slices.Concat` - concatenates multiple slices
- Shrinking functions (`Delete`, `Compact`, etc.) now zero removed elements

### Performance

- Profile-guided Optimization (PGO) improvements: 2-14% runtime improvement for most programs
- Better devirtualization and inlining of interface method calls

### Tooling

- Refreshed trace tool web UI with thread-oriented view
- `go get` no longer works in legacy GOPATH mode (GO111MODULE=off)

### Bootstrap

- Requires Go 1.20 or later to build from source

Sources:
- [Go 1.22 Release Notes](https://tip.golang.org/doc/go1.22)
- [Go 1.22 is released! - Official Blog](https://go.dev/blog/go1.22)
- [Go 1.22 Interactive Tour](https://antonz.org/go-1-22/)

result:
## Go 1.22 Release Summary

Go 1.22 was released on February 6, 2024. Here are the key highlights:

### Language Changes

**For Loop Fix:**
- Loop variables are now created fresh for each iteration, fixing a long-standing source of bugs where closures would capture the same variable
- New range-over-integers syntax: `for i := range 10` instead of `for i := 0; i < 10; i++`

### Standard Library

**math/rand/v2** - First "v2" package in the standard library:
- Cleaner, more consistent API
- Uses ChaCha8 algorithm for higher-quality, faster pseudo-random generation

**Enhanced HTTP Routing (net/http.ServeMux):**
- Patterns now accept HTTP methods and wildcards
- Example: `GET /task/{id}/` matches only GET requests and captures `{id}`

**Other additions:**
- `database/sql.Null[T]` - generic type for nullable columns
- `slices.Concat` - concatenates multiple slices
- Shrinking functions (`Delete`, `Compact`, etc.) now zero removed elements

### Performance

- Profile-guided Optimization (PGO) improvements: 2-14% runtime improvement for most programs
- Better devirtualization and inlining of interface method calls

### Tooling

- Refreshed trace tool web UI with thread-oriented view
- `go get` no longer works in legacy GOPATH mode (GO111MODULE=off)

### Bootstrap

- Requires Go 1.20 or later to build from source

Sources:
- [Go 1.22 Release Notes](https://tip.golang.org/doc/go1.22)
- [Go 1.22 is released! - Official Blog](https://go.dev/blog/go1.22)
- [Go 1.22 Interactive Tour](https://antonz.org/go-1-22/)
